Package fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.instance

Class Study

java.lang.Object
fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.instance.Study
All Implemented Interfaces:
AccessElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
DBStudy
public abstract class Study extends Object implements AccessElement
Instance of a Study in Soile. This reflects a running instance of a project. The Project Management (during creation and modfication of the project) is handled in the Project class, which represents a project in the database that the StudyManager links with the respective code in the git Repository. To walk through a Project the following steps are necessary: Participant participant taskID = proj.startProject(participant) taskID = proj.finishStep(participant,taskDataJson) // taskID must be submitted in the finishStep taskID field, to confirm this is the right task. taskID = proj.finishStep(participant,taskDataJson)// taskID must be submitted in the finishStep taskID field, to confirm this is the right task. proj.finishStep(participant,taskDataJson) ...
Author:
Thomas Pfau

    • setupStudy

      protected void setupStudy(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject data) throws UnknownRandomizerException
      A Project will be set up based on the data provided here. The fields defined in the "Project" and "Study" schemas need to be specified in this json.
      Parameters:
      data - setup data for the study
      Throws:
      UnknownRandomizerException - if there is an unknown Randomizer in the study

    • instantiateStudy

      public static io.vertx.core.Future<Study> instantiateStudy(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject instantiationInfo, StudyFactory factory)
      Instantiate the project (return a Study when finished), where data is data the provided project implementation can use to retrieve the information required by setupProject.
      Parameters:
      instantiationInfo - All information needed by the Instance generated from the provided factory to create the instance.
      factory - The study generation factory
      Returns:
      a Future that will have the instantiated Study created from the factory.

    • finishStep

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> finishStep(Participant participant, io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject taskData)
      Finish a step for a particular participant storing the supplied output information obtained for the user.
      Parameters:
      participant - the participant for whom to finish the step
      taskData - the participants data for this task
      Returns:
      A Future of the next step for the given participant (which is also set if this is completed).

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the results data to be stored in a db.

    • getNextTask

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> getNextTask(String nextElementID, Participant user)
      Obtain the next element for the given user using the given element ID to query the next element
      Parameters:
      nextElementID - the assumed nextElementID for the user
      user - the user to check where to go to if the nextElement is the assumed next step.
      Returns:
      The next Task as defined by the element with the given ID, or null if the element is not defined (which means that we have reached an end-point).

    • startStudy

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> startStudy(Participant user)
      Start the project for the provided user.
      Parameters:
      user - the Participant to start the study for
      Returns:
      A Future of the position the user will be at after they have started.

    • setNextStep

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> setNextStep(Participant participant)
      Proceed the user to the next step within this project (depending on Filters etc pp). This will return the position the user was set to if everything succeeds.
      Parameters:
      participant - The user that proceeds to the next step.
      Returns:
      A future of the next step instance ID, or null if this is participant is finished.

      public io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray getTasksInstancesWithNames()

      Returns:
      A jsonArray of the format described above

    • updateStudy

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Long> updateStudy(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject updateInformation)
      Update the Study, returns the modification date set in the database.
      Parameters:
      updateInformation - the updating json information.
      Returns:
      A Future of the modified timestamp of the updated study

    • checkChangeAllowed

      protected abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Void> checkChangeAllowed(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject newData)
      Test whether a change with the new data is allowed (and or a change on this study in general)
      Parameters:
      newData - the new data that would change the Study
      Returns:
      A successful Future if the change is allowed

    • save

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> save(boolean sourceProjectChanged)
      This operation saves the Project. It should ensure that the data can be reconstructed by supplying what is returned form this function to the load() function of this class.
      Parameters:
      sourceProjectChanged - indicating whether the source project has changed for this save call
      Returns:
      A JsonObject

    • load

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> load(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject instanceInfo)
      Load all data that is necessary for the project. This function should work with the Data contained in the future provided by the save function.
      Parameters:
      instanceInfo - The object to retrieve the data from. Can be specific to the Actual implementation used. e.g. can only contain one ID if loading from a DB or multiple fields if construction from multiple DBs.
      Returns:
      A Future containing all data actually necessary for Study to reconstruct all necessary fields.

    • delete

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> delete()
      Delete the project instance represented by this Object. Note: This must NOT delete the actual Project data, but only the data associated with this run of the project.
      Returns:
      A future that contains the data that was associated with the Study. This function must NOT handle the deletion of it's participants, that deletion should be handled at whatever place this Future is requested.

    • reset

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> reset()
      Reset the project (this will remove any access tokens and clear the participants array for this study).
      Returns:
      A future that contains the participants array of this Study in order to remove their data.

    • deactivate

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Void> deactivate()
      Deactivate a project
      Returns:
      A Future that succeeded if the project was successfully deactivated (or was already inactive)

    • activate

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Void> activate()
      Restart a project if it was deactivated. By default a project is active.
      Returns:
      A Future that succeeded if the project was successfully activated (or was already active)

    • isActive

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> isActive()
      Check, whether the current project is active.
      Returns:
      A Future o the activity status of this Study.

    • addParticipant

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Void> addParticipant(Participant participant)
      Add a participant to the list of participants of this projects
      Parameters:
      participant - the participant to add
      Returns:
      A future that succeeded if the participant was successfully added

    • deleteParticipant

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> deleteParticipant(Participant participant)
      Delete a participant from the list of participants of this projects Will return false, if the participant was not removed
      Parameters:
      participant - the participant to remove
      Returns:
      A Future that returning true, if the participant was removed, or false if it wasn't

    • getParticipants

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> getParticipants()
      Get a list of Participants in the project
      Returns:
      A Future of a Jsonarray with all participant ids.

    • createSignupTokens

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> createSignupTokens(int count)
      Create a given number of Access tokens for this project.
      Parameters:
      count - - the number of access tokens to create
      Returns:
      - a JsonArray of one-time access tokens that can be used to sign up for this project

    • createPermanentAccessToken

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<String> createPermanentAccessToken()
      Create a general access token for this project. This token is reusable and not linked to a specific user. On signup, it will be exchanged against a individual access token.
      Returns:
      a Future containing the permanent Access token

    • getTokenInformation

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> getTokenInformation()
      Get information about the tokens for this Study, master, access and used tokens
      Returns:
      a Future of a JsonObject with entries for masterToken, signupTokens( JsonArray ) and usedTokens ( JsonArray )

    • useToken

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Void> useToken(String token)
      Use a token for the given project. If the provided token is a one-time token it will deactivate this token.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to use
      Returns:
      A successfull future, if the token is available.

    • getUpdateableDBFields

      public abstract FieldSpecifications getUpdateableDBFields()
      Get all Field Specs for updateable fields
      Returns:
      FieldSpecifications of all updateable fields

    • getStoredModificationDate

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Long> getStoredModificationDate()
      Get the modification date of this study stored in the database. This is only updated in the save() method of the Study, and does not consider modifications of fields which are accessed directly in the db and not stored on the project instance.
      Returns:
      A Future of the modification timestamp

    • getFilterPassesAndAddOne

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<Integer> getFilterPassesAndAddOne(String filterID)
      This will search for the given filterID in the filterPasses and update it to "one more"
      Parameters:
      filterID - the filter to update
      Returns:
      A Future of the new number of Filter passes
